author: potuz
content: We were looking into this, there seems to be issues on both Besu and prysm. Besu for some reason said that a payload was INVALID and prysm errored out (there's a fix that will be up soon in our repo, sorry for the delay). The jwt issue seems to be on Besu's side

author: terencechain
content: The "invalid payload + Prysm error'ed out" issue is unlikely the reason that is causing prysm-besu-1 node to go haywire given prysm did get an invalid respond, it just fails to prune. The jwt issue is more sus

author: robocopsgonemad
content: yeah, the jwt issue is gonna be a pita. there is a thread leak somewhere that is driving up contention so bad rpc methods are spanning past the token grace period.

author: terencechain
content:
I just checked prysm-geth, it actually returned VALID. So I think there are two issues here:

1.) Besu returned INVALID on a payload that some other EL clients returned VALID
2.) Prysm has an issue on pruning bad block on INVALID response

I only assumed 2 but it looks like 1 is also in play. For reference, this is the block at slot 34007
